bibl.title: Dispatch from Joao L. Torres to L. de R. du Verge
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.p: Translation To L. de R. du Verge Esqire United States Consul Loanda

Without any favor from you to answer, I satisfy my of the 8th of october per S.S. Benguella. Samples of produce from the district. Enclosed please find a bill of for a of samples of the produce of Mossamedes, which will be sent on by the first packet, due in a few days, the said samples consist of:--
Orchilla Beans Corn Rum Wheat Almeidina

With regard to these samples, I must say that Almeidina, is a providence from which 50 P.C. of good Indian Rubber is regards to wheat, this country has not produced anything to speak of, as they have not their attention to its cultivation, but lately and it has been shown to considerable extent, and they expect a great result.
Produce exported from this Dispatch: as follows

Hides Wax Ivory Dried Fish
Orchilla Almeidina Cotton
Vegetables Fruits Oxen Cows Sheep Rum Garden produce, Beans peas, &a &a wheat sown as stated above

"American Shipping" The Am: Ship "Shelton" Capt. S.B. Potter, entered this port on the 7th of october sailed on the 19th of the same month; Whaling? On the 12th of the same month entered America Back Alice Knowles Capt Promay Foster came in to request and returned Whaling on the 19th of the same. On the 10th of the same month entered Am. Ship Eliza Adams" Capt Walter F. Hourland: also came in to refresh and returned Whaling on the 24th ditto. From the Back "Alice Knowles" the Sailor Henry Williams was landed sick, and who will go on to your City by the first packet, leaving a Certificate from this agency dated october 26th 1882 The "Eliza Adams" shipped on the 25th ult. It values 2 of which ran away immediately after signing their articles and receiving 8 dollars and 50 cents in advance; they were arrested 2 days after the sailiing of the ship, and I sending them on to your consulate by first favorable opportunity that you may dispose of them as you may think fit; It is probable that I shall have to advance the money for their passage of which I will duly advise you their names are "David Miller" and "Charles Flint". Another sailor by name of "Augusto Fernandes" ran away from the said ship, and came today to present himself to me; I shall send him also to you with
with the other 2 and advise the amount of passages and expences which I have advanced them here of seems to me proper to send them to Loanda that it may be known here after to all others coming here in future, that such acts will not be comtenanced without being punished according to Law.
Being all for the present, I remain with all due respect and Consideration "Signed Joao L. Torres U.S. Consul Agent
P.S. The sailor above described as "Augustus Fernandes, is Augustus Jason".
